isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - ANTILOCK AIR BRAKE SYSTEM WITH TRACTION CONTROL: BENDIX - 9200, 9300 and 9400 - TROUBLESHOOTING - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcprocinfo.para:
All troubleshooting begins by observing the ABS Warning Light and the Traction Active Light located on the instrument panel. While the controller diagnostic display locates a specific problem area, it is necessary to confirm whether the problem is in the component or the connecting circuits. The fault trees, beginning with INITIAL START-UP TEST PROCEDURE
, guide the technician to the specific fault.

step1.para: Determine if the vehicle has traction control installed. With traction control there will be a Traction Active light and ON/OFF switch on the instrument panel
Place the traction control ON/OFF switch in the ON position, before beginning troubleshooting.

Begin the troubleshooting process by performing INITIAL START-UP TEST PROCEDURE
.
The service technician should record all findings and action taken during troubleshooting.
No voltage or resistance tests are performed into the controller. All tests in this manual will be on the vehicle harness side of controller connectors (350) and (355).
